Research Overview


I am interested in understanding how humans learn to sort stimuli into discrete equivalence classes based on their features (what one might call the classical view of categorization). This research often takes place in a controlled setting, but applications of category learning are visible just about everywhere. For example, a baseball player going up to bat will categorize an incoming pitch as a ball or a strike; they will not announce their category judgment, but will decide to swing or not swing based on their judgment.


See my CV for a list of my conference presentations.
